p: The dried G. lucidum was grounded in a grinder (DFY-500, Zhejiang Linda Co. Ltd., China) to a fine powder (40 mesh). The fine powder sample was pretreated with 80% ethanol to remove some colored materials, oligosaccharides, and some small molecule materials [ 28], and then dried at 40C in an oven. The treated powder (1 g) was mixed with 40 mL of deionized water in a 150 mL flask, and extracted for 2 h at 95C. The extraction procedure was repeated once. The extract was centrifuged at 8000 Ã— g for 10 min. The combined supernatants were used for the estimation of crude polysaccharides or for further purification by ethanol precipitation when used in the assay of antioxidant activity.
